page.title: 03PLEASINGTON OLD HALL
page.content: The oldest part of the hall was built before{1587}and{Mr.E.Pawson}has lived inthe hall fifty six years.Above the door there is a{datestone}with the date of when that part of the house was built{"1587"}and the initials of both the owner and builder (it is thought).The style of the house is { {Elizabethan.}It has quite a few special features.It has{Mullioned} windows &{oak}beams.The front door of 2 inch thick oak has{metal studs}-one for each day of the year.Such a door would have made it difficult to break down & attack the Hall.The living room has an{Inglenook Fireplace.}Behind the fireplace there is a secret{Priesthole where the{Monks}used to hide in times of danger.The Hall stands in{seventy {acres}of land,under which is a{tunnel} leading to another Hall nearby,used to escape from the Old Hall unobserved.
